snippet: Grandmasters from Azerbaijan and Vietnam won two fast-play world championships last weekend that were notable because none of the top seven players bothered to show up.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column on World Rapid Championship and World Blitz, both held in Khanty-Mansiysk, in central Russia.
lead_paragraph: Grandmasters from Azerbaijan and Vietnam won two fast-play world championships last weekend that were notable because none of the top seven players bothered to show up.

headline.print_headline: Top Seven in the World Skip Two Tournaments
headline.main: Top Seven in the World Skip Two Tournaments
